newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold volume and prices jump.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold volume and prices jump.

text.p: Prices leapt on Istanbul's gold exchange on Tuesday in line with the higher levels in Europe and volume rose sharply on firmer free market demand, dealers said.
Gold closed at $383.10 an ounce and 1,177,000 lira per gram, up from Monday's $380.80 and 1,169,500 lira. There were no dollar deals in the second session.
Traded volume jumped by 45 percent from Monday to 770 kilos and 80 percent of it was made in lira terms.
"Expectations of further increases in world gold prices boosted free market demand in the morning," pone dealer said.
"Expectations that the lira would weaken against the dollar in the afternoon also boosted morning buys," he addded.
The lira closed slightly easier at 95,350 to the dollar on banks' dollar purchases in the afternoon, despite a lower dollar/mark parity in international markets.
It had firmed to 95,240 in morning trade from Monday's 95,320 close.
Only 115 kilos of gold changed hands in the second session after 655 in the morning.
